;

;In April and May 2021, the China Securities Regulatory Commission issued documents and regulations to strengthen the system. Supervision of employees who have left their jobs investing in companies to be listed. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;A company planning to be listed on the Science and Technology Innovation Board has a rare appearance of 8 China Securities Regulatory Commission (hereinafter referred to as the China Securities Regulatory Commission) Will) Employees who have resigned from the system hold shares indirectly.

;

;Deyi Microelectronics Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Deyi Micro), which is the focus of heated discussion, was established in 2017. Its main business is the research and development, design and sales of storage control chips and storage solutions. The application for IPO was accepted on November 29, 2022.

;

;After sending the first round of inquiry letters, the Shanghai Stock Exchange believed that Yiwei’s explanation of the stock purchase matters by employees who had resigned from the China Securities Regulatory Commission system was still insufficient, and asked Yiwei again to elaborate in the second round of inquiries. Please ask sponsors and lawyers to verify and issue clear opinions.

;

;Deyiwei responded twice and stated that the above eight people did not engage in improper shareholding and did not need to be liquidated.

;

;On September 13, 2023, the relevant person in charge of the Shanghai Stock Exchange also responded that these eight people mainly invested indirectly through employee stock ownership plans, equity incentive plans and other methods established by relevant investment institutions, and did not involve The investment behavior is led by employees who have resigned, and the number of shares they indirectly hold in the issuer is less than 1 share.

;

;For a long time, employees who have resigned from the China Securities Regulatory Commission system have taken shares in companies to be listed, which will arouse the sensitive nerves of the market. In April and May 2021, the China Securities Regulatory Commission issued documents and regulations to strengthen the supervision of system resignation personnel’s investment in companies to be listed.

;

;Who are the eight employees who have resigned from the China Securities Regulatory Commission system? Why did they gather even a little bit?

;

;;Omissions to disclose;

;

;At first, Deyiwei did not fully disclose the stockholding status of personnel who left the CSRC system.

;

;In the prospectus submitted on November 29, 2022, Deyiwei only briefly stated that 5 former employees of the China Securities Regulatory Commission system held less than 1 share of the issuer, and there was no improper shareholding. In addition, there are no other situations in which system personnel who have resigned from the system acquire shares as specified by the Securities Regulatory Commission.

;

;However, the announcement of the second round of inquiry responses showed that among the indirect shareholders of Deyiwei, there are 8 people who have resigned from the China Securities Regulatory Commission system. Among them, three of them, Wang Jun, Luo Haobin, and Yue Xinyu, were the first round of inquiry responders ( Added after June 30, 2023).

;

;But Yiwei failed to clearly introduce the identity of the new indirect shareholder Yue Xinyu, and only introduced him as a "leading cadre not above the department level" in the first round of inquiry responses, saying that he was "relevant Shareholders have not provided information on Yue Xinyu’s specific employment status in the China Securities Regulatory Commission system; according to searches by sponsors and issuer lawyers, there is no relevant public information.”

;

;Following inquiries from the Shanghai Stock Exchange, Deyiwei checked public information and an announcement from another company that was earlier than the release date of its first-round inquiry letter reply, and only confirmed it in the second round of inquiry responses. Yue Xinyu’s identity.

;

;This means that when submitting the prospectus, Deyiwei omitted to disclose that three resigned personnel from the China Securities Regulatory Commission participated in the shares, and did not verify the identity of one of them.

;

;According to the "Guidelines on the Application of Regulatory Rules - Issuance Category No. 2" (hereinafter referred to as the "Guidelines") issued by the China Securities Regulatory Commission on May 28, 2021, issuers and intermediaries are submitting issuance application documents. When doing so, a special explanation should be submitted to explain the situation of system personnel who have left the company to join the company.

;

;Among the above eight resigned personnel, Liang Yuyin, Wang Jun, Luo Haobin and Yue Xinyu indirectly hold the equity of E Fund through the shareholding platform of E Fund Management Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as E Fund), and then indirectly hold the equity of E Fund. Get a micro-share.

;

;Announcements from multiple companies show that Liang Yuyin worked at the Shenzhen Stock Exchange from July 2011 to August 2016. He was the assistant manager of the fixed income department of the exchange when he left, and is now the deputy director of the infrastructure investment department of E Fund Fund. General manager.

;

;Wang Jun worked at the Guangdong Supervision Bureau of the China Securities Regulatory Commission from June 2011 to June 2017, serving as chief staff officer at that time. After leaving his job, he joined E Fund Asset Management Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as E Fund Asset Management), and then joined E Fund in March 2020. He is currently the managing director of E Fund.

;

;Luo Haobin worked at the Guangdong Supervision Bureau of the China Securities Regulatory Commission from June 2013 to September 2019 as the chief clerk. He is now the assistant to the general manager of the Operations Compliance Department at E Fund. He, Wang Jun and Liang Yuyin participated in the E Fund Employee Stock Ownership Plan in October 2019.

;

;Yue Xinyu worked at the Henan Supervision Bureau of the China Securities Regulatory Commission from July 2011 to January 2018 as the chief clerk. He now works at E Fund as the general manager of the institutional client department. He and Wang Jun participated in the E Fund Employee Stock Ownership Plan in November 2020.

;

;Liu Yu, Wang Guiyuan and Huang Xunyun from Minsheng Securities also received Yiwei shares indirectly through participating in the employee equity incentive plan.

;

;According to company announcements and public information, Liu Yu, Wang Guiyuan and Huang Xunyun left the China Securities Regulatory Commission system in March 2018, July 2017 and May 2016 respectively, and were then directors of the Corporate Supervision Division of the Heilongjiang Securities Regulatory Bureau. Staff member, seconded by Shenzhen Stock Exchange to be a pre-reviewer of the Sixth Division of the Issuance Department of the China Securities Regulatory Commission and an executive manager of the Listed Company Supervision Department of the Shanghai Stock Exchange.

;

;Currently, Wang Guiyuan is the managing director of the investment banking department of Minsheng Securities, and Huang Xunyun is the assistant to the president and general manager of the strategic account headquarters of Minsheng Securities. According to Caixin, Liu Yu is currently the general manager of the compliance department of Minsheng Securities and has intention to leave.

;

;Liu Yu, Wang Guiyuan and Huang Xunyun participated in the Minsheng Securities employee equity incentive plan in May 2020, June 2020 and December 2021 respectively, and invested in the employee stock ownership platform.

;

;The last one among the 8 people is Peng Junheng, the "old man" of the China Securities Regulatory Commission system. He has worked within the China Securities Regulatory Commission system since 1996. He served as deputy director of the Futures Department of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, deputy general manager of the Shanghai Futures Exchange, and director-level inspector of the Shanghai Supervision Bureau of the China Securities Regulatory Commission. He resigned in December 2017 and in 2018. Joined Shanghai Fuyou Financial Services Group Co., Ltd.

;

;Peng Junheng invested 10 million in Tianjin Feixuan Technology Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Tianjin Feixuan) in September 2019, and the latter indirectly held Yiwei shares.

;

;Peng Junheng is also the only cadre above the division level among the eight resigned personnel. According to the "Guidelines", employees at the deputy director level (middle level) and above have a three-year ban on equity participation after leaving the company, and other employees have a two-year ban.

;

;The time when Peng Junheng invested in Tianjin Feixuan was less than three years after he left the China Securities Regulatory Commission system. However, because Peng Junheng was a person who had resigned before the release of the "Guidelines", the prohibition period on investment does not apply to his investment behavior. .

;

;In the view of Wang Jiyue, a senior investment banker, most of the shares held by the above eight resigned personnel in the company to be listed come from the equity incentives of their companies, and they are all indirect shares after multi-layer penetration, and the proportion is very small. , has little say in the entire investment.

;

;“It’s not that these people have discussed and invested in this company in disguise, it’s just a coincidence.” Wang Jiyue told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;;Not only Deyiwei;

;

;In fact, not only Deyiwei has gathered the above-mentioned personnel who have left the CSRC system.

;

;Through E Fund’s employee shareholding platform, Liang Yuyin, Wang Jun, Luo Haobin and Yue Xinyu also indirectly hold shares in the proposed listed companies Feiyu Technology, Wangyuan Technology and Qihui Pharmaceutical. Liang Yuyin personally also holds indirect shares in Shenzhen Anke, a company to be listed, and Kangwei Century (688426.SH), a listed company.

;

;Minsheng Securities Liu Yu, Wang Guiyuan and Huang Xunyun indirectly hold shares in the companies to be listed, Hengye Microchip and Dehe Technology. The first two also hold shares indirectly in Shenzhen Anke. Peng Junheng indirectly holds shares in Shenzhen Anke and Kangwei Century through Tianjin Feixuan.

;

;In other words, Shenzhen Anke is a place where Peng Junheng and people who have left the China Securities Regulatory Commission system who worked for E Fund and Minsheng Securities gather again.

;

;The company’s official website shows that Shenzhen Anke High-Tech Co., Ltd. was established in 1986. It is one of the earliest companies in China to develop large-scale medical imaging equipment and minimally invasive treatment equipment. Its products are exported to more than 50 countries. and regions, the GEM IPO application was accepted on June 30, 2022.

;

;According to the response to the first round of inquiry letters, in addition to the above-mentioned resignations from the China Securities Regulatory Commission system with indirect shareholdings, Shenzhen Anke also disclosed four other resignations.

;

;Feng Henian, Zhang Jie, Xu Rong and Fang Jie, who left the China Securities Regulatory Commission system between 2015 and 2017, worked for Minsheng Securities and indirectly held Shenzhen Anke shares through Minsheng Securities. However, as of the date of issuance of the inquiry letter reply (January 29, 2023), the above four people have withdrawn from the Minsheng Securities employee shareholding platform.

;

;The official website of the China Securities Regulatory Commission shows that Feng Henian, then chairman of Minsheng Securities and former party secretary and director of the Shandong Securities Regulatory Bureau, underwent disciplinary review and supervisory investigation in June 2022 for suspected serious violations of disciplines and laws.

;

;On January 6, 2023, the China Securities Regulatory Commission stated in a notice that Feng Henian was expelled from the party that Feng Henian had completely lost his ideals and beliefs. He actively planned a "way out" while he was in office, and continued to use his original position and status to amass money after leaving his job. , is a typical example of the "revolving door" corruption in politics and business. He has no bottom line in discipline and law, uses his former position and status to influence the issuance review work, seeks benefits for others, illegally accepts huge amounts of property, and accepts bribes from management service objects in the name of others. Extremely huge.

;

;On March 30, 2023, Shenzhen Anke suspended the listing review process for the third time, and applied to withdraw its issuance and listing application on June 16.

;

;It is worth noting that Liang Yuyin and Wang Jun both participated in the E Fund Employee Stock Ownership Plan in October 2019 and invested in the same employee stock ownership platform Zhuhai Juningkang Equity Investment Partnership (Limited Partnership) According to Qichacha, Wang Jun holds 2.3747% of the shares and Liang Yuyin holds 1.0067%. However, Shenzhen Anke and Kangwei Century, which Liang Yuyin indirectly holds shares, did not disclose Wang Jun's shareholding.

;

;According to the information disclosed by the above-mentioned companies, the way for the above-mentioned seven employees who have resigned from the China Securities Regulatory Commission to invest in the company to be listed is to invest in the securities firms and fund companies where they work through employee equity incentives, and the latter indirectly invest in Shenzhen Investment Holdings Donghai Small, Medium and Micro Venture Capital Enterprise (Limited Partnership) (hereinafter referred to as Shenzhen Investment Holdings), a number of private equity funds jointly funded by the Jiangsu provincial and municipal governments and the National Small and Medium Enterprises Development Fund Co., Ltd., these private equity funds eventually invested in companies to be listed.

;

;Among them, E Fund Management is a shareholder of the National Small and Medium Enterprises Development Fund. The latter was decided and deployed by the State Council in May 2020. Under the leadership of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology and the Ministry of Finance, it was jointly established by the central finance and Shanghai Guosheng, China Tobacco and other social investors as a parent fund. Through investment and establishment of sub-funds, etc. The total scale of the fund has reached more than 100 billion yuan, focusing on solving the medium and long-term equity financing problems of innovative small and medium-sized enterprises.

;

;E Fund and Minsheng Securities both indirectly hold shares in the private equity fund Shenzhen Investment Holdings. The actual controller of Shenzhen Investment Holdings is Shenzhen State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission.

;

;Tianjin Feixuan, which Peng Junheng invested in, also indirectly holds shares in the above-mentioned private equity funds and Shenzhen Investment Holdings, thereby indirectly investing in the company to be listed.

;

;In addition to the above-mentioned shareholding paths, there is another situation in which Minsheng Securities personnel who receive equity incentives hold indirect shares in companies to be listed.

;

;In Dehe Technology and Hengye Microchip, which are indirectly held by members of Minsheng Securities, Minsheng Securities is not only a sponsor, but also holds shares in the companies to be listed through subsidiaries. In Hengye Microcrystal, Minsheng Securities Investment Co., Ltd., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Minsheng Securities, was a new shareholder 12 months before the company's initial listing application. The shares directly held accounted for 1.44% of the company's total pre-issuance share capital.

;

;The China Securities Regulatory Commission stipulates that the red line for sponsor institutions to hold shares in an issuer is 7%.

;

;Among the above-mentioned companies, only Kangwei Century was successfully listed. Shenzhen Anke and Qihui Pharmaceutical both withdrew their listing applications, and the remaining companies are still in the IPO process.

;

;;"Going in both directions";

;

;It is not new for the personnel of the China Securities Regulatory Commission to leave their jobs and join market institutions, and major fund companies and securities firms are highly favored.

;

;According to incomplete statistics from the "Beijing News" in 2020, nearly ten CSRC officials have "went overseas" to work in financial institutions in the past three years. Compared with the situation a few years ago, when officials who "went overseas" were more inclined to fund companies, in recent years, most of the CSRC officials who "went overseas" worked for securities firms.

;

;For example, in early 2020, Huatai Securities announced the appointment of Jiao Xiaoning as the company's chief financial officer. Jiao Xiaoning served as deputy inspector and deputy director of the Accounting Department of the China Securities Regulatory Commission from January 2014 to January 2020. In May 2020, Guosen Securities appointed Deng Ge as the company's president. Deng had served as the director of the fifth supervision division of the First Department of Supervision of Listed Companies of the China Securities Regulatory Commission. He later served as the first batch of full-time spokespersons of the China Securities Regulatory Commission and the deputy director of the Listing Department of the China Securities Regulatory Commission.

;

;“It’s a two-way street.” A brokerage person explained to Southern Weekend reporters that in brokerages and fund companies, employees who leave the China Securities Regulatory Commission system can get relatively high salaries without having to hold high-level positions; These companies recruit ex-employees to use their connections with regulatory agencies to learn more.

;

;The brokerage firm believes that the problem of the revolving door of politics and business cannot rely solely on legal supervision, "but also on the invisible hand of the market."

;

;Wang Jiyue previously told Southern Weekend reporters, "In a mature registration-based market, if the listed entity cannot attract investors, it will have no value, and the situation of power rent-seeking will be alleviated."

; < p>;In their prospectuses, most of the above-mentioned companies have no or only one sentence brief description of the personnel who have left the CSRC system. Most of the details of the shareholdings of the resigned personnel gradually became clear after inquiries from the exchange.

;

;After the release of the "Guidelines", regulatory agencies have tightened the verification of employees who have left their jobs to invest in companies to be listed, but there are still companies that take risks and conceal all the way.

;

;Shadow Innovation, which was approved to accept IPO applications on October 28, 2020, is just one step away from being listed on the Science and Technology Innovation Board after more than two years of preparation.

;

;On November 22, 2022, Shadow Stone Innovation received a 115-word inquiry from the China Securities Regulatory Commission, requiring it to provide additional information on the shareholding status of the natural person "Chen Bin" and the procedures for transferring shares to external parties. Background, motivation, etc.

;

;Since the disclosure of IPO application materials (including inquiry response materials), Shadow Stone Innovation has never mentioned Chen Bin.

;

;The "Economic Information Daily" investigation found that Chen Bin was a person who resigned from the China Securities Regulatory Commission system. He worked at the Shenzhen Stock Exchange from August 1999 to March 2012, serving as senior manager, assistant to the director of the Comprehensive Research Institute, and deputy chief researcher. He also served as the chief representative of the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in Fujian Province and a listed company on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange. Head of the company's research team.

;

;Through layers of nesting and cross-shareholdings, Chen Bin’s shareholding in Shadow Stone Innovation appears to be quite complicated and hidden. During the IPO filing period of Shadow Stone Innovation, Chen Bin also transferred his holdings. Equity.

;

;As of now, Shadow Stone Innovation has not responded to this, and there is no latest progress on the IPO.

;On September 20, Guangzhou issued the "Notice on Optimizing Policies for the Stable and Healthy Development of the City's Real Estate Market" (Part 2 (called "Notice"), taking the first step in partially relaxing purchase restrictions in first-tier cities across the country. This new property market policy has the characteristics of large intensity and wide scope, striving to promote the transformation and high-quality development of the city's real estate market in an orderly and effective manner. At the same time, the "Notice" aims to implement classified and precise policies, continue to increase the construction and supply of affordable housing, better meet residents' rigid and improved housing needs, and resolutely curb speculation and speculation.

;

;At present, in the critical period of structural adjustment of the real estate industry, Guangzhou City actively responds to and implements the national real estate macro-control policy. In recent days, Guangzhou has taken the lead in implementing the "recognize the house but not the loan" policy in the first-tier cities. Mortgage interest rates were the first to break through the lower limit of LPR. This time, Guangzhou still took the lead among first-tier cities and opened up a new development situation in the real estate industry.

;

;The "Notice" mainly includes three parts: including relaxing purchase restrictions in some areas, relaxing the qualifications for non-household registered persons to purchase houses, and adjusting the value-added tax exemption period for personal sales of housing from 5 years to 2 years, etc., and many measures. At the same time, we will promote the recovery of the real estate market. In addition, yesterday, the Guangzhou Municipal Bureau of Housing and Urban-Rural Development issued the "Notice of the General Office of the Guangzhou Municipal People's Government on Further Strengthening Housing Security for Household Registration Households (Draft for Comments)", which will jointly improve Guangzhou's "rental and purchase" housing security. mechanism.

;

;New Deal Questions and Answers

;

;Q: What are the specific purchase restriction and non-purchase restriction areas in Guangzhou City in the future?

;

;Answer: The "Notice" states that households registered in Guangzhou are located in Yuexiu, Haizhu, Liwan, Tianhe, and Baiyun (excluding Jianggao Town, Taihe Town, Renhe Town, and Zhongluotan Town), Nansha and other areas still limit the purchase of two houses. This means that except for the areas mentioned above, purchase restrictions are no longer set in other areas of Guangzhou.

;

;Q: Can families who are not residents registered in this city enjoy the liberalized regional dividend?

;

;Answer: The "Notice" clearly states that non-local resident households are limited to purchasing one house in the above-mentioned areas. The conditions for purchasing a house are that they must have paid continuous personal income tax payment certificates or social insurance certificates for 2 years in Guangzhou before the date of purchase. Year. Previously, non-registered residents in Guangzhou were required to meet proof of continuous payment of personal income tax or social insurance certificate for five years to purchase a house in Guangzhou. This new policy lowers the threshold for non-registered residents to purchase houses.

;

;In addition, the "Notice" stipulates that in addition to calculations based on family units, adult single (including divorced) people with household registration in this city in Yuexiu, Haizhu, Liwan, Tianhe, Baiyun (excluding Jianggao Town, Taiyuan) Hezhen, Renhe Town, and Zhongluotan Town) are still limited to purchasing one house.

;

;Q: Will the new policy have any impact on foreigners purchasing houses in Guangzhou?

;

;Answer: Overseas institutions and individuals purchase houses in accordance with the "Opinions on Regulating the Access and Management of Foreign Investment in the Real Estate Market" (Jianfanghuang [2006] No. 171), the "Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development and other departments on the adjustment of foreign investment in the real estate market" "Notice on Relevant Policies for Access and Management" (Jianfang [2015] No. 122) is implemented.

;

;Q: After the issuance of this "Notice", what will be the timetable for policy implementation?

;

;Answer: The policy adjustment will be implemented from 0:00 on September 20, 2023. If the applicable policy for house purchase qualification review is inconsistent with this notice, this notice shall prevail.

;

;Q: The value-added tax exemption period for personal housing sales has been reduced from 5 years to 2 years. How to implement it?

;

;Answer: The value-added tax exemption period for individual sales of housing in Yuexiu, Haizhu, Liwan, Tianhe, Baiyun, Huangpu, Panyu, Nansha, Zengcheng and other districts will be adjusted from 5 years to 2 years. The applicable determination of the policy is based on The specific review opinions of the tax department shall prevail.

;

;Q: Does the issuance of the "Notice" mean that Guangzhou will realize that everyone has a place to live in the future, and the commercial housing market will be more dominated?

;

;Answer: Guangzhou City has always adhered to the housing security system of "both renting and purchasing". During the "14th Five-Year Plan" period, Guangzhou City proposed to add 660,000 units (rooms) of affordable housing, which is higher than The number of newly added commercial houses (650,000 units) during the same period made it the city with the largest supply of affordable housing among first-tier cities in the country.

;

;Relevant departments of the Guangzhou Municipal Housing and Urban-Rural Development Bureau introduced that next, the city will further increase the construction and supply of affordable housing, and accelerate the establishment and improvement of public rental housing, affordable rental housing and allotment of affordable housing. A housing security system with housing as the mainstay and both renting and purchasing.

;

;At the same time, we will continue to provide basic guarantees for public rental housing, raise the income threshold and rental subsidy standards for public rental housing in a timely manner, further expand the scope of public rental housing security, and guide some security targets to solve their housing problems by receiving subsidies. Difficult issues and improve public rental housing security methods.

;

; Vigorously developing affordable rental housing will provide policy support for land, finance, taxation, etc. from the government, and guide various market entities to participate in raising affordable rental housing to alleviate the housing difficulties of new citizens and young people. Accelerate the establishment and improvement of supporting policy systems for allotment of affordable housing.

;

;[Voice]

;

;In response to this new policy in Guangzhou’s real estate market, Southern+ reporters immediately contacted experts to explain what impact it will have on the city’s real estate industry in the subsequent stages after the new policy is released. ? Hear what the experts have to say.

;

;Ou Jiangbo, director of the Economic Research Institute of the Guangzhou Academy of Social Sciences and deputy director of the Expert Committee of the Guangzhou and Guangdong Real Estate Association:

;

;This adjustment and optimization of real estate development policies is very necessary. And importantly, it will play a very good role in boosting and promoting the real estate market and economic and social development of Guangzhou. Mainly reflected in the following three aspects:

;

;1. Conducive to the stable and healthy development of Guangzhou’s real estate market

;

;In view of the huge changes in the development environment at home and abroad and the lagging impact of the three-year epidemic, the current real estate market There is indeed great downward pressure on the market and the macroeconomy, and relevant policies are in great need to be adjusted and optimized. The policies introduced in the early stage, such as "recognizing a house but not a loan" and "lowering interest rates and lowering down payments," are generally indirect and mild, and the policy strength and effect are not enough. The relaxation of the "purchase restriction and foreign purchase restriction" policy introduced this time is a relaxation of administrative control policies. It is direct, substantive, very important, necessary and timely. I believe it will definitely boost and promote the market. effect. As a national central city and a first-tier city, the steady and healthy development of Guangzhou's real estate market will also serve as a good example and driving role for other second-, third-, and fourth-tier cities in the country. Therefore, Guangzhou’s policy optimization and adjustment this time is of great significance and deserves high recognition.

;

;2. Conducive to the coordinated and balanced development of the real estate market and housing security

;

;It is worth noting that this policy optimization and adjustment not only optimizes and adjusts the real estate market policy, but also further strengthens the The safeguard policy emphasizes the proper separation, balanced efforts, and mutual promotion of the market and safeguards. It clarifies fuzzy thinking conceptually and strengthens the direction and intensity of work in action, which is conducive to making the market bigger, stronger, and better, as well as better safeguards. It is conducive to the high-quality coordinated development of real estate, economy and society.

;

;3. It is conducive to the coordinated and integrated development between various districts in Guangzhou and between Guangzhou and surrounding areas

;

;This policy optimization and adjustment is mainly aimed at the peripheral areas of Guangzhou, while the central urban area and Nansha District are still The implementation of relatively strict purchase restriction measures fully considers the actual conditions of industry, population and real estate market in each district, which well reflects the principle of "district-specific policies" and is conducive to better coordinated development among various districts in Guangzhou.

;

;In fact, with the strong implementation of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area plan, the integration of the Greater Bay Area is accelerating. Currently, more than 50% of the working population in Guangzhou is non-locally registered. Guangzhou is a very open city. , a dynamic city, the appropriate relaxation of policies such as "purchase restrictions and foreign purchase restrictions" fully meets the objective needs of the integrated development of the Greater Bay Area. This optimization and adjustment of real estate policies will not only have great significance in promoting real estate in Guangzhou, but also be of great benefit to the long-term economic, spatial and social development of Guangzhou and the Greater Bay Area.

;Among contemporary Chinese writers of detective novels, "Forensic Physician Qin Ming" is a very unique existence. On the one hand, there are actually many contemporary writers with police work experience, such as Remy, Ah Yi, etc., but authors like Qin Ming who combine their work experience and professional skills with detective novel writing so closely can be called " Unparalleled." On the other hand, if "Forensic Qin Ming" is regarded as a cultural phenomenon in a broader sense, it started from novels, and later gradually extended to different cultural forms such as film and television, variety shows, and even became the profession of "forensic medicine" in many people's minds. synonym. Among them, the intertwining of the forensic profession and literary creation has created an amazing cultural communication power.

;

;;

;

;Qin Ming is a front-line public security forensic doctor who has examined thousands of corpses for 26 years. He is also a suspense writer and has written the Forensic Qin Ming series, the Hummingbird series, the Night Watch series, and the popular science book series. ;(Wang Yi/Picture);

;

;As a forensic doctor, I am full of awe and curiosity: why did he choose This career? After working in this somewhat mysterious profession for decades, how has your mentality changed? Faced with the large number of literature and film and television dramas about forensics or ghost stories today, what new perspectives can his profession provide?

;

;I have many questions about Qin Ming as a writer: How does he deal with the issues of fiction and reality in novel writing? How does he view the ethical boundaries of writing in crime novels? What is his reading tendency and self-identity towards the genre literary tradition of detective novels? And when I learned during the interview that Qin Ming’s favorite Chinese detective novel writer was Hai Yan, many of the questions I had previously had were solved, and a genealogy of the development of Chinese public security literature gradually became clear before my eyes.

;

;Of course, in the latest novel "White Scroll", we get to know Qin Ming as a father. Compared with the "bad boy" narrative that was popular in detective literature in previous years, "White Scroll" is about Qin Ming. The way children imagine the weak may be more traditional, but it is also more in line with the real concerns and anxieties of contemporary parents. In this novel, the forensic doctor is still the main body of action in the novel, but the father is more able to convey the author's inner voice.

;

;The chat with Qin Ming lasted less than two hours, but I felt a sense of solidity, trust and security on the other end of the phone. This may be due to the simplicity and sincerity revealed in his words and voice, or it may be due to his many years of professional experience in front-line police work. And during this chat, I also vaguely felt the possibility of another understanding of the sense of reality in the novel "Forensic Qin Ming". This sense of reality does not lie in whether the story itself is "purely fictional", but in a kind of Perseverance in writing attitude and inner belief in justice.

;

;Forensic Medicine in Reality

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Qin Mingyou Well, since the publication of your first novel "Corpse Whisperer" in 2012, through the publication of more than a dozen novels, the adaptation of many film and television dramas, and now the very popular variety show "Jobs -" Forensic Season". Forensic medicine, which was originally a relatively niche and somewhat mysterious profession, has now gradually become well-known to the public. Why did you choose the profession of forensic medicine in the first place? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;When I was in middle school, I basically didn’t know much about forensic medicine. My father was a policeman and my mother was a nurse. My father had a special interest in me. I had the complex and expectation that a son should inherit his father's career and become a police officer. However, my mother felt that being a police officer was too dangerous. Later, when I applied for a volunteer, I compromised and applied for a forensic medicine job. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When you take an anatomy class for the first time, What are the scenes and feelings like? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;I went to college in 1998 and began to study in the professional field of forensic medicine. In the process of studying and working, I gradually realized the forensic medicine importance. For example, the first story in my novel "The Corpse Whisperer" tells the story of a fight between several young people, and one person was stabbed to death. It was originally a very simple case, but it required forensic identification of the tools that caused the injuries in order to accurately determine their respective legal responsibilities. The key point is that the deceased in this case was an acquaintance of mine, so it posed a great psychological challenge to me. This was my first anatomy class, and I was very impressed. I was deeply shocked by the importance of forensic work, and from then on I set my life ambition: I must be a good forensic doctor in my life. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When you later engaged in forensic work, Will there be any changes in your mind? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;At first I would feel very angry with the criminal and hate the evil as much as I hate them. But the sign of a true maturity of a forensic doctor is his indifference. He will not pay too much attention to things other than the case. Instead, he will put all his energy on the autopsy and try his best to find clues. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;That is, as forensic doctors continue to accumulate work experience, Not only has the professional and technical level been improved, but also the entire personality has been tempered and changed. ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;I think it should be like this. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Before, I thought forensic medicine was a type of doctor. The main task is to perform an autopsy. But through your novels and the "Forensic Season" program, I discovered that forensic doctors also have to undertake a lot of work in on-site investigation, physical evidence identification, and even case reasoning. ;

;

;;

;

;In 2023, forensic doctor Qin Ming will participate in the reality show "Forensic Medicine Season 2" as a guest. The picture shows the poster of the show. ;(data map/picture);

;

;;Qin Ming:;;Yes, our Chinese public security organs have set up As a forensic department, public security forensic doctors must participate in case scene investigation and case investigation. In some Western countries, forensic doctors, as independent inspection agencies, usually only need to identify three pieces of information: cause of death, time of death, and instrument of injury, and generally will not express opinions on other than these three issues. However, in our investigation process, all police types must play their maximum role within their professional scope, so that they can solve the case most efficiently. We often say that the center of a murder scene is the corpse, and the forensic doctor is the only police officer who comes into contact with the corpse, so the forensic doctor will have the core information of the entire scene. Therefore, our forensic doctors often have to participate in more case analysis and reasoning processes. This also ensures that our various police departments work together as a whole to maximize the effectiveness of the team and solve cases with the highest efficiency. ;

;

;I wrote a story in my book about the murder of a family of five. The murderer used knives to kill the host and hostess, the host’s mother, nanny and children. The five bodies were all covered with knives. The injuries were fatal. Only the nanny and the old lady's heads still had scars from the hammer, and they were still injured after death. When encountering such a case, many Western forensic institutions will feel that the cause of death, time of death, and the instrument of injury are very clear when conducting examinations, and will not proceed to the next step of reasoning. But our forensic doctors will continue to reason based on these clues: Why did the murderer hit these two people's heads with a hammer after they died? The biggest possibility is that it is reinforced damage, just to ensure that the deceased will die, and if she is not dead, she will be hit twice. So under what circumstances would reinforced damage be used? That means the deceased knew the murderer. So why only use reinforced damage on old ladies and nannies? It means that only two of them in the family of five know the murderer, and no other family members know him. Who could the murderer be? We speculated that he might be a vegetable vendor in the market, who usually only has contact with old ladies and nannies. As a result, we greatly reduced the scope of investigation and improved the police's efficiency in solving crimes. Therefore, I say that allowing forensic doctors to be more involved in the entire process of investigation, reasoning and solving cases is actually an institutional arrangement that is more suitable for our country's national conditions and can greatly improve the efficiency of solving cases.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What a wonderful reasoning. In many other current criminal investigation dramas, suspense films, or mystery novels, the role of forensic doctors is also set up, and they are given important functions in solving crimes. However, most of the forensic characters in these film and television dramas or novels are women - such as the female forensic doctor Gao Yanan in the TV series "White Night" (2017), and the female forensic doctor in Hu Yanyun's novel "Sweeping Rat Ridge" (2020). Forensic doctor Lei Rong et al. I wonder what the gender ratio is between men and women in the real forensic profession? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;Movies and TV dramas may be based on dramatic considerations, so many female forensic roles are set up. However, in the actual gender composition of the profession, the majority of forensic doctors are men. The ratio of men to women in Anhui Province is about 10:1. The advantage of men engaging in forensic medicine may be that many autopsies are actually laborious work, and sometimes they need to go to the remote mountains and forests in the middle of the night. But female forensic doctors also have their own advantages. For example, they are often more meticulous and can handle some details better. At the same time, a lot of the work of forensic doctors is to assess injuries. When it comes to female injured people, female forensic doctors also have their own conveniences. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When it comes to forensic-themed film and television dramas, in addition to urban themes In addition, the profession of forensic medicine is now increasingly entering the public eye, which in turn has led to the popularity of another type of film and television dramas, which are works with ancient ghosts or autopsy personnel as the protagonists. From the early "The Punisher of the Song Dynasty" (2005) to the recent "The Imperial Gift of Xiaowu" (2021), even Gongsun Ce, who was beside Bao Zheng, had to some extent the ability to perform autopsies. In my opinion, this is actually using some modern forensic technology and spirit to reimagine an ancient puppeteer. Do you usually watch these film and television works? What do you think of these works? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;As you said, the essence of the "criminal officials" or "husbands" in these ancient film and television dramas is still based on modern Artistic image processing performed by forensic medicine. To give two examples, one is that according to ancient customs, in most cases corpses cannot be dissected, and the case can only be concluded through autopsy. Of course, for many cases, autopsy can also roughly clarify the basic situation of the case. Unless there are doubts that cannot be resolved by autopsy, the body can be dissected. Another is that the ancient corpses only had the function of cleaning and moving corpses, but did not have the function of identification. Only officials are qualified to conduct autopsies and identifications. In the ancient status hierarchy, wu Zuo was often a pariah and did not have such qualifications. He did not even have the right to fill in the autopsy records, while our modern forensic doctors have the right to identify. So the two costume dramas you mentioned are actually quite different. Song Ci in "The Punishment Officer of the Great Song Dynasty" is a Tidian criminal prosecutor of the fourth rank, while the protagonist in "The Imperial Gift of Xiaowu Zuo" is a Xiaowu Zuo. The two people's job functions and scope of power are actually different. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;That is to say, ancient works were subject to the feudal social class order Constrained by concepts, they cannot give full play to their professional knowledge and professional skills. This poses a significant limitation. ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;Yes. ;

;

;Writing novels “completely stems from grievances”

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In addition to being a forensic doctor, your other important identity is a writer. Why did you initially choose to write a novel about your forensic experience? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;My writing stems entirely from grievances. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How to say? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;After I engage in the profession of forensic medicine, on the one hand, I will feel the importance, even greatness and sublimity of this profession. But on the other hand, in daily life, forensic doctors will also encounter some misunderstandings and discrimination. For example, after some people know that I am a forensic doctor, they are unwilling to shake my hand or eat at the same table with me, thinking that it is bad luck. Within the public security system, forensic medicine as a police force also needs to be paid more attention to and valued. We often tend to see the police who finally arrest the criminals, but tend to ignore the forensic doctors who are behind the scenes and have done a lot of identification and reasoning work. At the same time, I also write novels to popularize some basic forensic knowledge, so that when a case does occur, netizens will have better forensic literacy and will not be easily deceived by rumors. ;

;

;;

;

;Forensic doctor Qin Ming. ;(ELLE Magazine/Picture);

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;It is equivalent to obtaining correct forensic knowledge, which in some cases improves the ability to identify rumors. ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;Yes, at the same time, I also hope to deter crime. Someone asked me before, aren't you worried that readers will commit crimes after reading your novels? I said I'm not afraid. I don't write novels to attract attention, but I hope my readers will understand after reading my novels that we have the most professional forensics and the highest detection rate. Here "if you commit a crime, you will be caught." I hope that my novel can make kind people be more vigilant and make people with evil intentions put down their butcher knives. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Well, in fact, the creative attitude determines the specific way of writing the novel. are different, correspondingly, the final writing effect and reader impact will also be different. ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;Yes, that’s right. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What do you think is society’s current understanding of forensic medicine? Is it getting better? Do you still feel the grievances you felt when you first wrote? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;Now the public knows more and more about forensic medicine, and they are increasingly aware of the characteristics and greatness of the profession of forensic medicine. . ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;The "Forensic Qin Ming" series of novels is particularly touching. What’s great about it is the sense of reality revealed in it, which is a reality derived from daily work experience. For example, in your novel, you talk about the details of the forensic doctor shaving the hair of the dead body. The scalpel must be used to shave the hair cleanly without damaging the scalp. At first glance, it is a detail that can only be written by a professional. So why did you initially choose the fictional literary form of novels? Have you ever considered writing non-fiction documentary works? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;This involves some issues of writing ethics and case confidentiality. The novels I write are basically a combination of fiction and reality. Forensic work and reasoning are "real", but the case itself is "fictitious". I may have made up a case story, but the daily routine and core reasoning points of forensic work are all real and come from life. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;This combination of virtuality and reality is also very interesting. Do you usually like to read detective novels? Who are your favorite detective novel writers and works? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;My favorite writer has not changed in so many years, it is Hai Yan, but to be precise, he does not write detective novels. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Well, actually Haiyan is in a broader sense It is written on the theme of public security and incorporates quite a few elements of romance novels into it. ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;Yes, he has an urban style. The first Hai Yan novel I read was "Plain Clothes Police". The novel was written very early, but I only got into the trap after I went to college in 2000. Later, the second book was "A Romantic Affair", as well as "Death in Youth", "Jade Guanyin" and "Deep Prison", including the later "Dancer" and "Chang'an Robbers", which I bought immediately. Among those who came here to read, I liked the book "Deep Prison" the most. Later, Jiao Junyan went to star in the movie "The Bandits of Chang'an". She was the heroine in my first online drama, and she was also from Anhui. We were very familiar with each other, so I was very excited when I heard that she was going to star in this movie adapted from Hai Yan's novel. . In addition to Hai Yan, I also read Remy's "Psychological Crime" series, Zhou Haohui's "Death Notice" series, including Ma Boyong's novels. I don't know if they are considered mystery novels, but I also like to read them. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;I heard that you and Remy have some fun relationship experience? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;Remy is a teacher at the Criminal Police Academy. I am a student at the Criminal Police Academy. I went to the Criminal Police Academy to study for a degree after graduating from university. Double bachelor, so even though Remi and I are about the same age, he did serve as my teacher. In addition, after I finished writing my first novel and sent it to him for reading, he made three suggestions that have impressed me to this day: first, please clarify the usage of "的,地,得"; second, read less novels of the same type, Continue to maintain your own style; third, be a writer who can write for a long time. I think I have basically implemented the three suggestions he made at the beginning. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What a very frank suggestion. Would you say that Remy's portraits of criminal psychology in Fang Mu are more fantasy and fiction, while your "Forensic Qin Ming" series is more realism? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;I don’t think the character Fang Mu is completely fictional. On the one hand, criminal psychological profiling technology is very important in specific crime research and solving cases. It does exist in the process; on the other hand, I think Fang Mu may be a collection of many successful cases of outstanding public security officers, and it is not completely fictitious. In contrast, my "Forensic Qin Ming" series may be more convincing because forensic science is a natural science. I will explain scientific principles to you and come up with a conclusion to solve the case, which you think is credible. But psychological analysis is also based on science. ;

;

;“Erasing the footprints will leave more traces of wiping”

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;If the "Forensic Qin Ming" series is also placed in the literary tradition of detective novels, since Conan Doyle's "Sherlock Holmes", detective Holmes actually has two skills : One is the meticulous on-site observation ability. Footprints, fingerprints, bloodstains, hair, soot, no detail will escape Holmes's eyes, and these can often constitute the key clues for his final solution of the case; the other is his ability to observe the scene in detail. Strong logical reasoning ability, as Holmes himself said: "Logicians can deduce from a drop of water whether it comes from the Atlantic Ocean or Niagara Falls, without having to see or hear about the Atlantic Ocean or Niagara Falls. Life is a huge chain, as long as we see one link, we can infer the characteristics of the entire chain." If we look at the two literary traditions created by Sherlock Holmes novels, the "Forensic Qin Ming" series seems to have inherited and developed the A tradition, and combining that tradition with a very specific, modern profession, creates a certain sense of authenticity. What do you think of these two traditions of detective fiction? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;I think different writers have different writing emphases and concerns. People often ask me whether I am a conservative or a socialist. I say that I do not belong to either school because the things I write are not reasoning for the sake of reasoning, but reasoning for the purpose of solving crimes. If I have to summarize it, I think it can be called "realistic reasoning." On the one hand, real physical evidence is the premise and basis for reasoning; on the other hand, the combination of physical evidence and reasoning has the ultimate goal of solving the case. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Nowadays, a very important branch of mystery novels It's "secret room murder." In your "Survivor", the fourth case is the "Death Room". In "White Scroll", the tenth case is also called "The Heartbroken Chamber". Of course, I think the "secret room" mentioned in your novel is still very different from the concept of the "secret room" in current "Xinbenge" novels. What do you think of the secret room design in this mystery novel? If in "new original style" mystery novels, "secret room" often means a combination of some kind of wild imagination and rigorous logical reasoning, then in the eyes of forensic detectives, is it possible for a secret room to exist? Or will the so-called "secret room" definitely leave traces and clues deliberately forged by the murderer? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;I am very touched, because you really understood the meaning of my novel. We often say that as long as someone appears at the crime scene, material exchange will occur. For example, if you set up a very complicated secret room, we usually call it a "closed site". Can you not leave any traces? Many people say that just wiping off the footprints is enough, but wiping off the footprints will leave more traces of wiping. The more the suspect thinks about it and the more redundant actions he takes at the scene, the more clues and evidence he leaves for the police. Just like many people often ask me whether there are "high IQ crimes", I say that truly high IQ people will not commit crimes. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When it comes to "high IQ crimes", I think of Zijin Chen’s novel, he has a novel called "Undocumented Crime", in which there is a very interesting imagination, that is, the criminal is a top expert who is proficient in the two fields of forensics and forensics. When such a person commits a crime, there will be no scene at the scene. There will be some clues and evidence left. The detective who solved the case was a university mathematics teacher with super logical reasoning ability, so he formed a plot design in which the "King of Reasoning" solves the "undocumented crime", which is somewhat similar to the peak showdown in traditional martial arts novels. What do you think of this type of literary imagination? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;Different novelists have their own specialties and different ways of writing novels. I also like to read Zijin Chen’s novels. But our writing methods may be different. He is good at arranging reasoning, and my specialty is writing forensics. In my actual work, there is no "crime without evidence". "Undocumented" means "innocent". Only by finding evidence and forming a complete chain of evidence can a conviction be achieved, so my novel may focus more on evidence. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In your early novels, each story was They are relatively independent of each other, but the same group of forensic doctors connect these different cases and different short stories together. To a certain extent, it may be closer to a set of "short story collections" that are closely related to each other. You also said in the "Preface" to "Survivor" that one of the essences of the "Forensic Qin Ming" series is to "based on individual cases and add the main thread that intersperses the whole book." In the latest "White Scroll", I can clearly feel the overall design of the entire novel, which echoes and interlocks from beginning to end. The structure of a complex novel has been formed, such a chain of short stories to Were the changes in the novel an intentional result on your part? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;Yes, in fact, the "Forensic Qin Ming" series of novels is in volumes. The first six books are "The Corpse Whisperer" and "The Silent One". "Testimony", "The Eleventh Finger", "Scavenger", "Survivor" and "Peeper" are all "Volume of Vientiane", writing about all phenomena in the world, so they are closer to the writing style of a collection of short stories. Then starting from "The Condemned One", "The Condemned One", "The Forgotten One", "Doll" and "The White Scroll" are the "Volume of All Living Beings". I will have a very different writing method, that is, although each book still has several Case story, but overall written around a social issue. For example, "The Condemned" mainly focuses on social responsibility, "The Forgotten" mainly focuses on the decadent ideas of female virtue, "Doll" focuses on domestic violence, and this "White Scroll" mainly focuses on communication in the parent-child relationship. question. ;

;

;Another change in my writing of novels is that I reduced the length of murder cases in "The Volume of All Living Beings" and added stories of other accidental deaths. There are three main reasons: First, Lao Qin himself He is the author of the realism school, but in reality, murder cases are indeed becoming fewer and fewer; secondly, forensic work definitely not only plays a role in homicide cases, but also plays an irreplaceable role in the judgment of the manner of death and the entire litigation process. I hope my readers can see stories of forensic scientists playing a role in other fields; third, forensic work is extensive and profound. In addition to on-site analysis, there are many other cases that require forensic scientists to contribute. I hope my readers can see the story of forensic scientists playing a role in other fields. Gain a comprehensive understanding of the forensic science profession.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You wrote a lot in "White Volume" about parents and children Does your book’s focus on parent-child issues have anything to do with your daily interactions and intergenerational gaps, and your identity as a father? ;

;

;;Qin Ming: ;;This question is not easy to answer, because like my father, I was absent from the growth process of my children. Due to work reasons, I used to travel for more than two hundred days a year. Now that I have fewer cases, I still have to travel for dozens to a hundred days. So I am quite busy at work, and I think I am still semi-absent in the education process of my children. But I am still very concerned about this issue, and hope to arouse everyone's concern for teenagers through novels. I want to trigger everyone's thinking, not preach. ;

;
