;A number of local courts held trials for the first time in the province to be adjudicated by people with specialized knowledge. environmental investment cases in which members participated. ;(People's Vision/Photo);

;

;Jiangkou County, Guizhou Province has taken a step forward in exploring the professionalism of people's assessors.

;

;On September 8, 2023, the Jiangkou County Court, Public Security Bureau, and Justice Bureau jointly issued an announcement to select 60 people's jurors from permanent residents in the county, including 10 with expertise in environmental resources. People's Assessor.

;

;Not long ago, the Supreme People's Court issued the "Several Provisions on People's Assessors with Specialized Knowledge to Participate in the Trial of Environmental Resources Cases" on July 27, 2023 (hereinafter referred to as the "Regulations"). This is not only a special demand for environmental resource cases (hereinafter referred to as "environmental resource cases") that have surged in number in recent years and are extremely professional, but also a new expansion of the people's assessor system.

;

;After the regulations were promulgated, Baicheng City in Jilin Province, Yangjiang City in Guangdong Province, Weichang County in Hebei Province, Lijin County in Shandong Province, Hunnan District in Shenyang City in Liaoning Province, Heilongjiang Forestry District and other places successively held court hearings on the province’s first cases involving persons with disabilities. People's assessors with specialized knowledge participate in environmental investment cases.

;

;The jury system has only played a role in China's judicial field for a short time. In August 2004, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress reviewed and passed the "Decision on Improving the People's Assessor System", which clarified the people's assessor system for the first time, and China had "unrobed judges."

;

;However, the phenomenon of people's jurors "accompanying the case but not trying the case, trying the case without deliberation" and "having no purpose" is common, and has been criticized by the society and the legal circles. In April 2018, the Jury Law was officially promulgated, establishing principles such as random selection of jurors, term limits, and the "grand collegial panel system", which has changed the shortcomings of the past to a certain extent.

;

;Prior to this, China’s judicial system has set up an expert assistant system. The Criminal Procedure Law, Civil Procedure Law and other specialized laws revised after 2012 also increasingly advocate “expert assistants with specialized knowledge”. People appear in court." However, whether they are "experts" or "people with specialized knowledge", they are all intended to solve professional and technical problems in the trial, and they all fall into the category of witnesses and evidence.

;

;In recent years, in some cases in special fields, more and more "expert" people's jurors have appeared in collegial panels.

;

;Chen Yongsheng, a professor of law at Peking University, said that the collegial panel consults professionals during the trial of cases, which has always existed in judicial practice. This institutionalization will help improve the professional trial level of environmental and capital-related cases. "It is foreseeable that people with specialized knowledge will serve as jurors in other highly professional fields in the future."

;

;;The "thrush" whose identity is questionable;

;

;What kind of birds are the "thrush" and "spotted water sparrow"? Is it a thrush? Is it the same bird?

;

; In a case of illegal hunting of ferret badgers and "thrushes" heard by the Hanyuan County Court in Sichuan, the presiding judge He Gang encountered a problem. When the trial opened in May 2023, the court invited Li Zhihua, a staff member of the County Forestry Bureau, and Cao Lixiang, a staff member of the Qianyu Town Animal Health Supervision Office, to participate in the trial. Their identities were "professional people's jurors."

;

;This is the first environmental investment case in Sichuan to be heard by "professional people's assessors", and it occurred before the regulations of the Supreme People's Court were promulgated.

;

;The Hanyuan County Procuratorate accused Li Moumou of Malie Village of illegally manufacturing and possessing guns since 2018, and using slingshots and nail guns to hunt and kill multiple "Thrushes" and "thrushes" since 2020. A "flower nose pattern".

;

;Because the case is not serious, this case adopts a simplified procedure, and the collegial panel adopts a "1 (judge) + 2 (people's assessor)" structure. The presiding judge, He Gang, is in his thirties and has served as a judge for 8 years. Although he has rich trial experience, he has insufficient biological knowledge.

;

;The fur involved in the case was identified by Sichuan Agricultural University and was indeed a ferret and badger, a wild animal protected by the country’s “Three Certainties”. However, the thrush is a national second-level protected animal. What kind of bird the criminal mentioned as the "thrush" and how many there are are related to conviction and sentencing. Cao Lixiang and Li Zhihua, a staff member of the Hanyuan County Forestry Bureau, are here to help solve this problem.

;

;Cao Lixiang is a veterinarian with 30 years of experience. Since 2015, he has been recommended by the town government and selected as a people's assessor of the Hanyuan County Court. So far, he has participated in 20 or 30 court trials, but most of them were grassroots civil disputes.  

;

;This case in May 2023 was the first time that Cao Lixiang and Li Zhihua used their professional backgrounds to serve as jurors as "people's jurors with specialized knowledge."

;

;Cao Lixiang and Li Zhihua read the case files provided by the court in advance. During the trial, Cao Lixiang asked a number of questions: What gun did you use to shoot? Where did you get the call? How many shots were fired? Was it one hit, or several hits? Where did the ferret badger hit? After questioning, it was compared with the captured ferret and badger pelts.

;

;In the past few years of practice, Cao Lixiang has learned to check witness and physical evidence, "to see if it is consistent with his confession. To prevent scapegoating."

;

;Cao Lixiang further asked about the characteristics of the "Thrush" that Li Moumou hunted: What was the fur like? What color is it? Where does feather color change? What are the characteristics of the head, tail, and trunk?

;

;As for the issue of "Thrush", Li Moumou's expression included different dialect names such as "Thrush" and "Thrush". Cao Lixiang and Li Zhihua said that in rural areas of Hanyuan County, the "thrush (sound mi) bird" does not necessarily correspond to a real thrush, but may also be a water sparrow or other birds. There are many types of thrushes in biology.

;

;Cao Lixiang hopes to determine whether the bird Li killed is a thrush, a second-level national protected animal, through biological characteristics, living habits, flight height and movements. However, since the characteristics confessed by Li Moumou are inconsistent with the biological characteristics of the thrush, and there was no physical evidence at the time of the crime, reasonable doubt cannot be ruled out.

;

;In the end, due to insufficient evidence, the court did not recognize the fact that Li Moumou "hunted" the thrush. Li Moumou was convicted of illegal hunting for hunting ferret badgers and was sentenced to four months in prison. In addition to the two charges of illegally manufacturing guns and illegally possessing guns, he was punished for several crimes and was sentenced to three years and six months in prison.

;

;;

;

;After the people's jurors with professional knowledge expressed their opinions, the Hanyuan County Court in Sichuan did not recognize the fact that a defendant "hunted" the thrush. ;(People's Vision/Picture);

;

;;The "thing" that cannot speak;

;

; He Gang said that environmental investment cases are different from ordinary cases. "Most of the time, things that affect the environment are a kind of 'object'. Objects cannot speak, and they involve professional problems. For example, if a plant in a place dies, it may be There are many reasons for the accumulation."

;

;If the judge looks up the information by himself, it will be limited to the knowledge structure, which will either consume time, or be inaccurate and unauthoritative. At this time, it is crucial for someone with specialized knowledge to provide professional advice.

;

;Another characteristic of environmental investment cases is that no one pays attention to them in the early stage. By the time they are discovered, the cycle of contamination or damage has been very long.

;

;Sun Youhai, executive director of the China Green Development Research Institute of Tianjin University, was the director of the Bill Office of the Environment and Resources Protection Committee of the National People's Congress. He published a paper in 2022 "The Expert Juror System in the Context of Environmental Justice Specialization" Study" mentioned that environmental resource cases have complex causal relationships, resulting in long trial times. Due to the lack of professional knowledge, parties may easily doubt the fairness of court trials, affecting judicial credibility.

;

;For example, Sun Youhai took the 2007 exhaust gas case from a mining and chemical company in Fujian. From 2010 to 2012, it went through prosecution, first-instance judgment, appeal, remand for retrial, second-instance judgment, application for retrial, and remand for retrial. The tortuous process of the retrial and the retrial judgment caused dissatisfaction among the parties involved. “One of the core reasons for the long and repetitive trial process is that the appraisal opinions of different appraisal agencies are inconsistent. However, environmental judges do not have professional environmental knowledge, so they cannot make accurate judgments on the appraisal opinions in a timely manner, which leads to the judicial organs’ inconsistencies in case trials and judgments. It is difficult to characterize the case.”

;

;From the actual trial of environmental and capital-related cases, it is necessary to improve the professionalism of jurors.

;

;As early as April 2019, the Supreme People’s Court issued a judicial interpretation of the Jury Law, which stipulated that “if the type of case requires people’s jurors with corresponding professional knowledge to participate in collegial panel trials, they may be The circumstances of the case shall be determined by random selection from the list of people's jurors who meet professional needs." Since then, "expert jurors" have been selected for cases in the fields of intellectual property, minors, finance, medical disputes, and network technology.

;

;In comparison, environmental investment cases involve chemical, biological, forestry, animal husbandry, minerals, land, water resources and other subcategories. They are more professional and difficult for laymen to judge. The needs are also more urgent.

;

; The regulations issued by the Supreme Law on environmental capital cases clarify that "people's jurors with specialized knowledge" refer to those who have specialized knowledge in the field of environmental resources, or who have experience in environmental resources administrative departments, scientific research institutes, higher education institutions, etc. Jurors who have worked in institutions, enterprises, social organizations and other units for more than three years. This regulation will be implemented from August 1, 2023.

;

;In fact, before the regulations were promulgated, courts at all levels across the country had already conducted many relevant explorations and practices.

;

;The People's Court of Qingzhen City, Guizhou Province established China's first ecological protection court in 2007. In December 2010, the court invited two people to hear a case of illegal discharge of sewage from a paper mill. The "people's assessors" include Shuai Jiang, a senior environmental engineer and director of Guiyang's Two Lakes and One Reservoir Management Bureau, and Liu Xiaojing, a Ph.D. in environmental protection. An expert advisory committee was convened to conduct demonstrations.

;

;In 2014, the Wanzhou District Court of Chongqing approved the appointment of four environmental experts including Yao Weizhi, deputy director of the Fisheries Resources Research Institute of Southwest University, and Ren Ping, director of the Wanzhou District Forestry Science Institute, to serve as jurors He has participated in the trial of a series of cases including the Fengjie County electromagnetic radiation case, the yew pollution case, and the Kaixian cattle farm land pollution case.

;

;Some places are also actively building expert databases for environmental jurors. For example, the Higher People's Court of Guizhou Province issued the "Regulations on the Participation of Environmental Expert Jurors in Case Trials" in early 2014 and established an expert database for ecological and environmental jurors. From January 2016 to December 2017, Chongqing courts at all levels hired a total of 18 experts as expert jurors to participate in the collegial panel hearing of 124 cases.

;

;By 2022, it will gradually become a trend to invite experts with environmental protection expertise to serve as jurors.

;

;;Randomness and fairness;

;

;In 2018, the first special legal jury law on the people's assessor system was promulgated, which was widely praised by the legal community.

;

;Chen Yongsheng, a law professor at Peking University, believes that a very important point of the jury law is to strengthen the randomness of jurors.

;

;In the past, people's jurors in courts at all levels were mainly recommended by their units and grassroots organizations, or jurors recommended themselves. After the promulgation of the Juror Law, although the recommendation model has been retained, the main method of selection is that the judicial administrative agency, together with the courts and the public security agency, randomly selects from the list of local residents, conducts a qualification review, and then submits it to the Standing Committee of the People's Congress at the same level for approval and approval. appointment.

;

;Chen Yongsheng also believes that before the law was enacted, the jury seats in many places were fixed and full-time for a long time. They were familiar with the judges and had difficulty in functioning. The random generation of jurors helps prevent judicial corruption. "The laws of psychology show that the possibility of corruption is higher when a person is dealing with acquaintances. On the contrary, in front of a stranger, if the other party violates the law, the other party will You may still have concerns about reporting and seeking improper benefits."

;

;In the 1980s and 1990s, China's legal system had a "negative attitude" towards the jury system. Academic circles call it the "low ebb" of the jury system. At that time, He Jiahong, who later became a law professor at Renmin University of China, was still studying in the United States and had begun to understand the American jury system. The Simpson case that occurred in the 1990s gave great inspiration to the Chinese legal community. "It turns out that cases in the United States can still be tried in this way and let some ordinary people decide."

;

;According to the Jury Law, the court selects 5 times the number of proposed jurors as candidates, and the number of jurors actually selected is not less than 3 times the number of judges of the court. In some pilot courts, the number of jurors is even 10 times that of judges. This is precisely to enhance the broadness and representativeness of the people's assessors.

;

;In 2018, the Juror Law stipulated that jurors must be at least 28 years old, which is higher than the 23 years old requirement in 2004. Chen Yongsheng once proposed that based on the principle of "same trial", the age limit should be expanded. "This is to expand and enhance the representativeness of judges. Because of the existing regulations, defendants under the age of 28 do not have the identity composition corresponding to Homogeneous jurors”.

;

;Behind this proposal, the inherent spirit of the jury system is reflected - jurors should not only be selected from legal professionals, such as university professors and judicial assistants, but also should introduce folk wisdom. In other words, let "lay people" participate in the trial.

;

; "Why should a jury system be established? Because the way people who have studied law has formatted their minds to think about problems, they are more rational than ordinary people. And private juries Based on perceptual life experience, a judge can fully understand the cause-and-effect connections and feelings and reactions of the defendant when he behaves better than a judge." Chen Yongsheng said that this will help the case judgment to be more in line with the legal provisions, and also help the court to maximize its effectiveness within the legal framework. Taking into account the humanity and personal feelings of the parties involved.

;

;In recent years, the judicial interpretation of the Supreme People's Court has changed the standard for determining "justifiable defense" due to the public opinion caused by many major cases, and it has become closer to human ethics. "If the jury system is used properly, it can achieve the organic unity of national law and human relations, national law and natural justice." Chen Yongsheng said.

;

;The Anglo-American jury system is composed of one team for each case, and a new team is formed for each case. Jurors in the civil law system also have a term limit of no more than two terms. "Whether it is the common law system or the civil law system, you cannot always serve as a juror to prevent jurors from changing from laymen to experts. Otherwise, the advantages that jurors may have as laymen cannot be used."

;

;According to statistics from the Supreme People's Court, as of 2021, there are more than 316,000 people's jurors across the country, an increase of about 50% from 2018. He Jiahong believes that in recent years, the number of cases nationwide has increased rapidly. Since 2019, the total number of cases accepted by people's courts at all levels across the country has been more than 30 million every year. "The number of cases involving specialized knowledge in various fields is also increasing. Therefore, the courts are facing the problem of insufficient manpower and brainpower." He Jiahong believes that the introduction of regulations this time to invite people with specialized knowledge to serve as people's assessors can effectively solve the problem of court manpower and brainpower. Lack of brain power.

;

;;

;

;People's assessors Cao Lixiang (middle) and Li Zhihua (right) are looking at relevant evidence. ;(Hanyuan County People's Court/Photo);

;

;;From "expert" to "professional knowledge";< /h4>;

;“This new regulation only institutionalizes a method that was widely used in previous practice in a certain type of case.” Chen Yongsheng said that British Justice Dan Dan was widely recognized by the Chinese legal circle. Lord Ning also mentioned in his book "Due Process of the Law" that an important function of the jury is to hire professional jurors to resolve professional issues. "It is foreseeable that the use of people with specialized knowledge to serve as jurors will also be implemented in other more professional fields in the future, or corresponding regulations will be introduced."

;

;Chen Yongsheng once served as a consulting expert and was invited by the Public Security Bureau to discuss some environmental protection cases, but he admitted that he could only express opinions on the legal issues involved.

;

;In 2022, Chen Yongsheng encountered a criminal case involving pollution caused by the accumulation of construction waste. The procuratorate hoped to determine whether the suspect committed a crime by understanding the degree of harm and whether to prosecute. "I don't know whether a kind of garbage is harmful to the environment. I think construction waste is nothing more than steel bars and cement and should be harmless. But professionals say that the accumulation of construction waste will damage the soil and cultivated land, and it will also be damaged after being wet by rain. Some toxic substances will be released. This requires specialized researchers to understand." In the end, the opinions of environmental experts played an important reference role.

;

;In 2021, before the regulations were promulgated, Tianjin University Law School was entrusted to hold an expert seminar on "Several Provisions of the Supreme People's Court on the Participation of Expert People's Assessors in the Trial of Environmental Resources Cases" (Draft for Comments).

;

;In the final regulations, "expert people's assessors" were changed to "people's assessors with specialized knowledge." The change in title was based on practical considerations.

;

;In Chen Yongsheng's view, the so-called experts should at least have a master's degree or even a doctorate, work in a university or scientific research institution, and have an intermediate or even deputy senior professional title. "The ideal situation is of course for experts to serve as jurors. But there are more than 3,000 courts across the country, and more than 90% of them are grassroots courts. If the status is limited to experts, the threshold is too high, and grassroots courts obviously cannot do it." In fact, the grassroots courts cannot do it. , the professional issues in most cases only need to be identified by people with relevant professional background and experience.

;

;In addition, "person with specialized knowledge" is also a relatively common term in law. There are many provisions in the current Criminal Procedure Law and Civil Procedure Law to "hire persons with specialized knowledge" to appear in court or Make an appraisal. Chen Yongsheng explained, "This 'person with specialized knowledge' is called an expert assistant in the legal world, and is sometimes called an expert witness."

;

;But obviously, these all belong to the category of witnesses, and are not the same as those introduced in the collegial panel. Knowledgeable jurors are two different judicial paths and directions.

;

;Zeng Xiangbin, a lawyer at Hubei Huanyuan Law Firm, has conducted dozens of public interest litigations on environmental investment cases. "I have not found a case where professional issues have affected the fair trial of the court." "The existing litigation system is sufficient, and there is no need to find an additional professional person."

;

;Chen Yongsheng does not agree with this. Chen Yongsheng believes that the expert witness and judicial appraisal system serve both parties in the dispute. The appraisal reports issued by each party are generally beneficial to them, and the expert witnesses invited are often also beneficial to them. In the same case, the appraisal results of the plaintiff and the defendant are sometimes opposite, and even the procuratorate’s appraisal results are inconsistent several times. “At this time, jurors with professional knowledge stand in a neutral position to judge the prosecution and defense.” It is necessary to distinguish the true from the false and eliminate the false while retaining the true.”

;

;Sun Youhai also pointed out in the paper that expert assistants are only responsible for the parties, and their neutrality and independence are lacking. This is different for jurors with professional knowledge. On the one hand, they can scientifically determine the evidence and facts of the case; On the other hand, it can also effectively supervise the trial work of the court on behalf of the people.

;

;;Equality of power with judges must be ensured;;;

;

;The regulations announced by the Supreme People’s Court this time will apply to basic people’s courts and intermediate people’s courts. When hearing environmental resources cases, clear requirements are put forward for the number of "people's jurors with specialized knowledge", and requirements are also put forward for the number of collegial panels depending on the circumstances of the case, which is basically consistent with the principles of the Jury Law.  

;

;Both He Jiahong and Chen Yongsheng believe that although the legislation is relatively complete, the biggest problem in judicial practice is that the jury system has not been fully implemented. In recent years, some cases with significant social impact have not all adopted the jury system. Chen Yongsheng believes that "Although the case handling agency also made excuses, for example, it was worried that the jurors would not be able to manipulate and make decisions, their excuses were not convincing. It violated the legislative purpose of the Juror Law."

;

; He Jiahong also expressed regret, "Including judicial reforms in countries with civil law systems such as France, major and serious criminal cases have adopted the jury system. However, in our country for many years, some major cases have not required juries, but daily ordinary cases have used juries. "

;

;He and some legal experts were invited by the court to observe some court trials. One expert said, "This case is not very important, and the defendant also pleaded guilty and there is no dispute. Why do we need jurors? ?"

;

;He Jiahong believes that these cases with great social impact were originally excellent opportunities to promote the concept of the jury system to the society, but they were wasted. "With extremely high attention, higher requirements have also been put forward on how court leaders and judges manage the collegiate bench."

;

;The reason is that Chen Yongsheng said that many cases need to be reported to special committees, adjudicatory committees, judges, deans, and even to higher-level courts, political and legal committees and other higher-level units before decisions can be made. result. “The decision-making power in many cases does not lie with the collegial panel.”

;

;Chen Yongsheng said, "The collegial panel has no decision-making power, let alone jurors. Even if the jurors express their opinions, they cannot affect the outcome of the case, which leads to the jurors being unwilling to actively exercise their right to serve as a jury."

;

;Specifically when it comes to the trial of environmental resources cases, Sun Youhai pointed out that a guarantee system should be provided for people's jurors with specialized knowledge, including the right to participate in the trial, the right to know the case and the right to vote on the case, to ensure that the jurors' rights and The equal power of judges allows them to "devote themselves whole-heartedly to the jury work of the case and have no worries when performing their jury duties."

;; (Visual China/Picture) ;

;

;"Congressman Lee, you are no longer alone." On the afternoon of September 19, 2023, former South Korean President Moon Jae-in appeared at a hospital in Seoul to visit Lee Jae-myung, leader of the opposition Democratic Party of Korea .

;

;Moon Jae-in held Lee Jae-myung's hands tightly and persuaded him to "stop the hunger strike" and engage in the "long-term battle" (of the Common Democratic Party) with a new attitude.

;

;Early the morning before, an ambulance took Li Zaiming to the hospital.

;

;"Lee was in extremely poor health tomorrow morning and was in a daze and had to make an emergency call." Park Sang-joon, spokesman for the Democratic Party of Korea, told South Korea's YTN radio station.

;

;September 18, 2023 was the 19th day of Li Zaiming's "hunger strike" to demonstrate against the Yin Xiyue government. On that day, the South Korean court once again filed an application for detention of Li Zaiming on the charge of "dereliction of duty."

;

;Lee Jae-myung accused the Yoon Seok-yue regime of undermining order and democracy in South Korea, and went on a hunger strike on August 31. As of now, Li Zaiming is out of danger, but his body is still weak. He stated that he would only maintain infusion treatment and continue his hunger strike.

;

;;Lee Jae-myung;;’s “indefinite hunger strike”;

;

;“As one of the citizens, I start today to challenge the incompetent and violent regime. 'National' resistance." On August 31, 2023, Lee Jae-myung announced an "indefinite hunger strike" at the press conference for the first anniversary of the Democratic Party of China.

;

;Li Zaiming made three demands to the ruling party: Yin Xiyue apologized to the people for destroying people's livelihood; the ruling party should oppose Japan's discharge of nuclear-contaminated water into the sea; and reorganize the cabinet.

;

;Lee Jae-myung is Moon Jae-in’s “successor” within the party. Before entering politics, Li Zaiming was a human rights lawyer and participated in human rights and citizen movements many times. From 2010 to 2021, Lee Jae-myung served successively as the mayor of Seongnam and the governor of Gyeonggi Province.

;

;In October 2021, Lee Jae-myung resigned as governor of Gyeonggi Province and participated in the South Korean presidential election. He narrowly lost to South Korean President Yoon Seok-yue and later became the leader of the Democratic Party of Korea.

;

;In the early days of the hunger strike, Li Zaiming set up a tent in front of the Capitol and conducted a sit-in protest. As Lee Jae-myung's health declined, he began to move into the party leader's office. Many senior figures from the Democratic Party of Korea and South Korean politicians came to persuade him to stop his hunger strike.

;

;According to Korean media reports, the ruling National Power Party "took no measures" in response to Lee Jae-myung's hunger strike.

; /p>;

;The "Central Daily News" editorial criticized the ruling party's inappropriate stance on "Lee Jae-myung's hunger strike." The National Power Party once ridiculed that "a seafood tasting event will be held near Lee Jae-myung's hunger strike tent."

;

;Sit-ins, marches and hunger strikes are common practice in South Korea’s political arena, and both the ruling and opposition parties will express condolences to hunger strikers. In the 1980s, when former South Korean President Kim Young-sam went on a hunger strike, the secretary of the then ruling party went to express condolences and conveyed then President Chun Doo-hwan’s intention to urge an end to the hunger strike; in 1990, when former South Korean President Kim Dae-jung went on a hunger strike to demand the full implementation of local autonomy , Jin Yongsan also went to express condolences.

;

;Facing pressure from public opinion, Kim Ki-hyun posted on social media on September 16, "solemnly requesting Lee Jae-myung to stop his hunger strike" and proposing to hold a meeting between the leaders of the ruling and opposition parties to discuss people's livelihood affairs after he "recovers his health."

;

;;“To avoid prosecution charges”? ;

;

;South Korean prosecutors once believed that Lee Jae-myung's hunger strike was suspected of avoiding the prosecutor's investigation.

;

;“This is the first time I have gone on a hunger strike after being notified of being summoned by the prosecutor.” Korean Minister of Justice Han Dong-hoon complained that the continued operation of the judicial system cannot be suspended just because a suspect under investigation went on a hunger strike.

;

;On September 4, South Korean prosecutors investigated Lee Jae-ming in connection with the "Sangling Group Bribery Case." It is believed that when he was the governor of Gyeonggi Province from 2019 to 2020, he was suspected of soliciting a bribe of approximately 10.6 billion won from Kim Sung-tae, chairman of Sangryong Group, on the pretext of paying for a visit to North Korea.

;

;In addition, Li Zaiming is related to two cases. From 2014 to 2015, while serving as the mayor of Seongnam City, Lee Jae-myung was suspected of taking care of real estate developers based on his position, causing the Seongnam Urban Development Corporation to lose 20 billion won. In February 2019, Lee Jae-myung was suspected of violating the Public Office Election Act and instigating others to provide false testimony that was favorable to him during his trial.

;

;On the morning of September 18, when Li Zaiming was seeking medical treatment, South Korean prosecutors merged the two suspicions of the "Sangling Group Bribery Case" and the "Real Estate Case" and applied for an arrest warrant against Li Zaiming.

;

;On September 19, Yin Xiyue, who was attending the United Nations General Assembly in New York, approved the arrest consent request sent by the prosecutor.

;

;As a current member of Congress, Lee Jae-myung enjoys the privilege of not being arrested without the consent of Congress. To arrest a member of Congress, more than half of the members must be present and more than half of the members must agree.

;

;According to South Korea's "Parliament Law", after receiving the consent for arrest, the Speaker of the National Assembly needs to convene a plenary meeting report on the matter and vote "within 24 hours and 72 hours" after the report.

;

;"South Korean prosecutors are using clues to bite Li Zaiming, but the possibility of him being arrested this time is not high." Li Jiacheng, associate professor at the School of International Economics and Politics at Liaoning University, analyzed to Southern Weekend reporters, South Korea in February 2023 The prosecutor's request to arrest Lee Jae-myung for the real estate case was rejected by Congress.

;

;Currently, South Korea has 297 current members of Congress, including 167 members from the Common Democratic Party, accounting for more than half of the opposition parties. This time, Li Zaiming's hunger strike received concern and condolences from important people within the party.

;

;According to the "Central Daily News" report, on September 20, the South Korean Congress will hold a plenary meeting to discuss the "Lee Jae-myung Arrest Consent Case" and vote on September 21.

;

;On September 21, the South Korean Congress will also vote on the "Recommendation for the Removal of Prime Minister Han Deok-soo."

;

;Due to Lee Jae-myung’s hunger strike, the Democratic Party of Korea submitted a proposal to dismiss Prime Minister Han Deok-soo on September 16, demanding the collective resignation of the ruling party’s cabinet. The move was seen as an attempt by the opposition parties to put pressure on the Yoon Seok-yue government.

;

;;The controversy behind the discharge of nuclear-contaminated water into the sea;

;

;On the recent "issue of Japan's discharge of nuclear-contaminated water into the sea", the Korean government and the opposition are quite divided.

;

;On the evening of August 23, before the hunger strike, Lee Jae-myung led more than a thousand people related to the Democratic Party of Korea to hold a candlelight rally. He accused "the East China Sea is turning into the Sea of ​​Japan" and urged the Yoon Seok-yue government to oppose the discharge of Japan's nuclear-contaminated water into the sea.

;

;The National Power Party represented by Yin Xiyue supports "discharging nuclear contaminated water into the sea" and sends a signal to the international community that "you will not die if you eat aquatic products." On August 29, the ruling party held a two-day and one-night "eating broadcast" to promote aquatic products.

;

;"Representative Lee (Jae-myeong) comes to a place like this and eats some (aquatic products)!" Park Dae-chu, chairman of the policy committee of the National Power Party, joked.

;

;"Ordinary people in South Korea strongly oppose Japan's discharge of nuclear-contaminated water into the sea, and the progressive Democratic Party supports the ordinary people. The National Power Party, which is dominated by conservative forces, is pro-American and pro-Japanese in foreign policy. Yoon Seok-yue The government strongly supports Japan's discharge of nuclear-contaminated water. The opposition between South Korea's ruling party and public opinion has become a political opportunity for Lee Jae-myung," Li Jiacheng told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Li Jiacheng believes that Li Zaiming’s hunger strike is more like preparation for canvassing votes for the 2024 South Korean parliamentary election. On the one hand, he united the "unknown" forces within the Democratic Party of Korea, and on the other hand, he fought for the "people" and won the sympathy votes of voters.

;

;On April 10, 2024, the South Korean Congress will hold an election. Since Lee Jae-myung's Democratic Party holds a majority of seats in the National Assembly, the ruling National Power Party hopes to regain control of the National Assembly.

;

;Since Yin Xiyue narrowly defeated Democratic candidate Li Zaiming by a narrow margin of 0.73% in 2022, he has never admitted that Li Zaiming is his "dialogue partner." The two have not held formal talks since the election.

;

;"Yin Xiyue disdains talks with the suspect (Lee Jae-myung)." "The Hankyoreh" quoted a core figure of the ruling party as saying.

;

;On September 19, after Lee Jae-myung received medical treatment, according to a South Korean Media Tomato poll, less than 30% of the people gave a positive evaluation of ;Yin Xiyue's administration;.

;

;Nearly half of the people believe that Li Zaiming's hunger strike is a protest against "Yin Xiyue's mismanagement", and nearly 42% of people oppose "the arrest of Li Zaiming".
